column4: anyone know how to edit windows registry on a separate partition using ubuntu?
anyone have any clue as to how to edit windows registry on separate partition from ubuntu??
not sure if there is a windows registry editor for linux.. seems kind of backwards
wine does come with a registry editor.. perhaps you can use that in some way
lol yeah. i changed my system drive letter for kicks and giggles, thinking it would be easy to change from linux X-D
hehe.. guess you're lauging your way through a reinstall as we are speaking.. ;)
haha probably
there's nothing in the recovery thingy you can get if you boot from the install cd?
i'm just really surprised linux can't edit the files
i'm sure there is, i just wanted to do it the hard way
have you checked if perl or python has a windows registry editing module? might be worth checking.. it might also be using some windows low level api for the actual editing
ooo, that's a good idea. i'll poke around with it a bit
any suggestions on editing windows registry from python...?
search some python sites.. there are modules for just about anything. I would be surprised if there isn't one for dealing with the registry
excellent. time to learn some nifty stuff. thanks!
only python modules for editing windows registry are for windows platform...
think wine could run such modules?
mm.. it probable uses a windows api then..
sure.. I guess that would work.. perhaps only for editing the wine registry though
haha alrighty. i'll give it a shot. this is absurd and i love it
well class is over and i must be off. hopefully this will work. thanks for the help
you're welcome
